Indian Economy.title: The GST cut effect – 60 bps push to GDP growth, 100 bps fall in retail inflation
Indian Economy.summary: The immediate impact of the GST rate cuts on September 22 will be reduced prices – or lower inflation – of hundreds of goods and services, which will encourage consumers to buy more, leading to higher consumption and GDP growth.

Indian Economy.title: Mint Quick Edit | India’s services sector seems to be on a roll
Indian Economy.summary: A well-tracked gauge of this sector’s activity suggests strong momentum last month, with export orders rising sharply. Price levels may need to be watched for a well-rounded view.

Indian Economy.title: Can India keep the growth engine warm, or will tariffs and inflation stall the ride?
Indian Economy.summary: The stress on MSMEs may grow as tariffs kick in, just when key sectors were starting to recover says Madan Sabnavis, Chief Economist at Bank of Baroda

Stock Market.title: GST reforms fail to sustain market rally as Sensex retreats 650 points from day’s high
Stock Market.summary: The Sensex closed at 80,718.01, up just 150.30 points (0.19%), while the Nifty settled at 24,734.30, gaining a modest 19.25 points (0.08%) after retreating over 650 points from intraday highs

Stock Market.title: Nifty Bank Prediction Today – September 4, 2025: Nifty Bank futures: Chart indicates bullish intraday trend
Stock Market.summary: Nifty Bank index shows bullish bias with private banks outperforming, Nifty Bank futures may rise to 55,000.

Stock Market.title: Nifty Prediction Today – September 4, 2025: Nifty futures: Likely to gain further
Stock Market.summary: Nifty 50 opens with a gap-up, showing bullish bias; top gainers are Mahindra & Mahindra and Bajaj Finance.

Stock Market.title: Markets pare gains as GST reform momentum fades by midday
Stock Market.summary: Markets trimmed earlier gains by midday on Thursday, with the Sensex and Nifty giving up much of their morning rally despite positive sentiment around the GST Council’s sweeping tax reforms announced the previous day.

Stock Market.title: GST 2.0 reforms drive market rally as Nifty eyes 25,000 mark
Stock Market.summary: The Nifty 50 started was trading at 24,913.35, up 198.30 points at 9.53 am, while Sensex also rallied to 81,233.14, higher by 665.43 points, as expectations of a consumption boost ahead of the festive season lifted sentiment
